basics.name: Wen Su
basics.summary: A German-born theoretical physicist, widely ranked among the greatest and most influential scientists of all time

courses: Introduction to Machine Learning, Deep Learning

education.area: Data Science and Big Data Technology

work.name: Tesla(Shanghai) Co., Ltd
work.summary: Teaching at Palmer Physical Laboratory (now 302 Frist Campus Center). While not a professor at Princeton, I associated with the physics professors and continued to give lectures on campus.
highlights: Built ETL pipeline using SQLAlchemy to streamline data processing for 8 million+ customer text feedback from Hive to MySQL
Deployed a classification model for detecting customer demands based on Natural Language Processing algorithms textCNN and Bert, AUC of which reached 0.82

work.name: Bytedance Co., Ltd
work.summary: Teaching at Palmer Physical Laboratory (now 302 Frist Campus Center). While not a professor at Princeton, I associated with the physics professors and continued to give lectures on campus.
highlights: Designed data warehouse models to store billion-level data in Hive from TikTok moderation team
Optimized ETL data pipelines to guarantee stable data workflow in the stage of business expansion

awards.title: Second Prize in Shanghai, 2021 China Undergraduate Mathematical Contest in Modeling

publications.name: Zur Elektrody/namik bewegter Körper
publications.summary: It concerned an interpretation of the Michelson–Morley experiment and the properties of light and time. Special relativity incorporates the principle that the speed of light is the same for all inertial observers regardless of the state of motion of the source.

publications.name: Über einen die Erzeugung und Verwandlung des Lichtes betreffenden heuristischen Gesichtspunkt
publications.summary: In the second paper, he applied the quantum theory to light to explain the photoelectric effect. In particular, he used the idea of light quanta (photons) to explain experimental results, but stressed the importance of the experimental results. The importance of his work on the photoelectric effect earned him the Nobel Prize in Physics in 1921.

publications.name: Die Grundlage der allgemeinen Relativitätstheorie
publications.summary: The publication of the theory of general relativity made him internationally famous. He was professor of physics at the universities of Zurich (1909–1911) and Prague (1911–1912), before he returned to ETH Zurich (1912–1914).

projects.name: Long-term Traffic Flow Forecasting with Graph Neural Network
projects.summary: Quantum computing is the use of quantum-mechanical phenomena such as superposition and entanglement to perform computation. Computers that perform quantum computations are known as quantum computers.
highlights: Applied geometrics algebra, which improved feature extraction, to enhance neural network convolution, resulting in a more accurate prediction with historical data inputs

Put forward GAConvLSTM-GAT Model, which turned out 10% more accurate than the baseline models GAT and
GAConvLSTM under the condition of whole-day speed prediction

projects.name: Prediction for Loan Default based on Machine Learning
projects.summary: Quantum computing is the use of quantum-mechanical phenomena such as superposition and entanglement to perform computation. Computers that perform quantum computations are known as quantum computers.
highlights: Used Exploratory Data Analysis and designed new features to utilize domain knowledge and boost model performance
Constructed a tow-phase model based on Xgboost and GBDT; enlarged the scale of training data by figuring the threshold in the first phase and predicted loan default in the second phase
